title: Required Data
name: required
text: Please confirm which data you are contributing to the IMBIE GIA experiment group.

questions.name: uplift-rates-sheets
questions.text: 1a. Uplift rates and their associated uncertainties, distributed on a 0.5 degree grid:

questions.name: uplift-rates-upload
questions.text: 1b. Upload a data file and a metadata file describing the data file contents and format.

questions.name: stokes-coefficients-provided
questions.text: 2a. Stokes coefficients at least up to degree and order 90:

questions.name: stokes-coefficients-upload
questions.text: 2b. Upload a data file and a metadata file describing the data file contents and format.

title: Supporting Information
name: supporting
text: Please answer the following questions in relation to the data set you are submitting to the IMBIE GIA experiment group.

questions.name: created-aspects
questions.text: 3. Which aspect(s) of your GIA solution have you created?

options.text: Approach to sea-level loading and self-gravitation

questions.name: ice-history-model
questions.text: 4. Which ice history model have you employed in your GIA solution (including far field ice)?

options.text: Own model (to be described in supporting information)

questions.name: earth-model
questions.text: 5. Which Earth model have you employed in your GIA solution?

options.text: Own model (to be described in supporting information)

questions.name: gia-code
questions.text: 6. What code have you used to produce the GIA solution?

options.text: Own code (to be described in supporting information)

questions.name: rebound-data
questions.text: 7. Which rebound data (e.g. GPS or relative sea level, giving details of publications or online data sets) have you used to evaluate your GIA solution?

questions.name: other-constraints
questions.text: 8. Which other types of data have been used to constrain your GIA solution?

questions.name: methods-and-errors
questions.text: 9. Upload a document describing your GIA methods and errors in full. This must be either a peer reviewed journal article or a document suitable for review by the IMBIE executive committee. (If you wish to upload multiple files, please upload them as a single .zip file)

questions.name: comments
questions.text: 10. Is there anything else you would like to tell us about in relation to your participation in the IMBIE GIA experiment group?
